span.a: We have developed the WCSD Emergency Response Website to assist families in finding all updates and resources in one location. Information will be posted here as it becomes available. To access this website from our District page, click on "Select a School" and choose WCSD Emergency Response Website or click here.

p.span: #ICYMI Due to Governor Cuomos State Order, there is no public access to WCSD school campuses, including playgrounds. Thank you for your understanding

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h1.aria-label: Is it true school districts in Dutchess County will use paper ballots for the May Budget Vote?
h1.span: Is it true school districts in Dutchess County will use paper ballots for the May Budget Vote?

span.strong: 2020 Wappingers Vote Will Be On Paper Ballots

p.span: On Tuesday, May 19, the Wappingers CSD community will vote on the 2020/21 Budget, the annual transportation proposition, and will elect three members to the Board of Education. The Dutchess County Board of Elections has notified all Dutchess County school districts that due to the presidential primary and state/local primaries in April and June, they will not be able to assist with the school elections this year. In the past, local school districts have used voting machines from the Board of Elections.

As a result, WCSD will use paper ballots for the school district election this May. All voting locations will be open from 7:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. After polls close, ballot boxes will be opened and counted.Several processes are being put in place including verification of the number of voters to the number of ballots issued, and teams consisting of a reader and two counters who will independently tally the votes and compare results after every 25 ballots are counted.

br.span: We don't know how voting will be impacted due to COVID-19.
Please look for further details in the May budget newsletter expected in homes during the first week in May and on the Wappingers website at www.wappingersschools.org.

h1.aria-label: How do I find my poll site?
h1.span: How do I find my poll site?

strong.span: Looking for help to figure out which poll site you should go to?

p.span: Visithttps://vip.ntsteamed.comwhich is theVOTER INFORMATION PORTAL (VIP) service that helps voters look up if you are registered and where their poll site is located.

h1.span: A Message from Superintendent of Schools, Mr. Jos Carrin

span.span: Today, much of our national news has included information about the spread of the Coronavirus to areas around the globe.
Each day, the District receives updates of the Coronavirus.

a.span: Click here for resources from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

span.a: Please click here to continue reading.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.h1: Wappingers CSD is now usingAnonymous Alerts

p.span: The Anonymous Alerts reporting app was created to help students, parents or community members choose a school official to contact, type of incident to report, school building and/or a specific location, set a priority level of normal or high and upload a photo, screenshot or video related to the incident. This reporting system is meant to allow for anonymous reporting but still provides for District and Building Administrators to respond (via the app) to the person who submitted a tip to the District.

If you plan on submitting an alert anonymously please be sure to check the "message center" in the application itself to see any responses to your tip, or requests from District Officials for additional information.

span.strong: The purpose of theapp is for members of our school and community to report suspicious activity, bullying or student-related concerns to a school administrator. For all other reports, please contact your child's school directly. If you feel the need to keep this submission anonymous that is OK, we completely respect your right to privacy and appreciate you making us aware.

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

li.span: Download the Anonymous Alerts app for your Apple IOS or Android Device
Start the App, and enter the Activation Code: wappingerscsd
Submit reports to District & School Officials and check the message center within the App for additional correspondence with the District
Add a screenshot, photo, or video about an incident
